simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules
Class InflectionRule

java.lang.Object
  simplenlg.lexicon.lexicalrules.InflectionRule
All Implemented Interfaces:
MorphologicalRule
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdjectiveInflectionRule, NominalInflectionRule, VerbInflectionRule
public abstract class InflectionRule
extends Object
implements MorphologicalRule

Abstract implementation of MorphologicalRule. This is extended by NominalInflectionRule and VerbInflectionRule.

Inflectional rules are conceived as containers for PatternActionRules.

Author:
agatt

Method Detail

getName

public String getName()
Description copied from interface: MorphologicalRule
Get the name of this rule. This is usually a String that is used for fast indexing when MorphologicalRules are added to a Lexicon, and enables them to be called by name.

Specified by:
getName in interface MorphologicalRule
Returns:
The name of this rule.
See Also:
Lexicon.addRule(MorphologicalRule)

setRuleName

public void setRuleName(String newName)

appliesTo

public boolean appliesTo(LexicalItem lex)
Description copied from interface: MorphologicalRule
Check whether this rule applies to this LexicalItem. This should only return true if MorphologicalRule.appliesTo(Category) returns true when called with lex.getCategory().

Specified by:
appliesTo in interface MorphologicalRule
Parameters:
lex - the LexicalItem
Returns:
true if this rule applies to lex
See Also:
LexicalItem

appliesTo

Description copied from interface: MorphologicalRule
Check whether this rule applies to items of Category cat

Specified by:
appliesTo in interface MorphologicalRule
Parameters:
cat - the Category
Returns:
true if this rule is specified as applying to this Category, or to Category.ALL_CATEGORIES
